info.description:
RCABench - A comprehensive root cause analysis benchmarking platform for microservices
This API provides endpoints for managing datasets, algorithms, evaluations, and fault injections
for root cause analysis in distributed systems and microservices architectures.
info.title: RCABench API

get.description: Virtual endpoint for including all DTO type definitions in Swagger documentation. DO NOT USE in production.
Analyze fault injection data using various filtering conditions, returning statistical information including efficiency, diversity, distance between seeds, etc.

parameters.description: Status filter, refer to field mapping interface (/mapping) for specific values
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Fault type filter, refer to field mapping interface (/mapping) for specific values
parameters.name: fault_type

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default is not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect parameter format, validation failure, etc.

get.description: Analyze trace data using various filtering conditions, returning statistical information including traces ending with fault injection

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default is not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect parameter format, validation failure, etc.

post.description: Batch build datasets based on specified time range and benchmark container

parameters.description: List of dataset build requests; each request includes dataset name, time range, benchmark, and environment variable configuration
parameters.name: body

202.description: Successfully submitted dataset building tasks; returns group ID and trace information list

400.description: Bad request parameters: 1) Invalid JSON format 2) Empty dataset name 3) Invalid time range 4) Benchmark does not exist 5) Unsupported environment variable name

get.description: Package specified datasets into a ZIP file for download, automatically excluding result.csv and detector conclusion files. Supports downloading by group ID or dataset name (mutually exclusive). Directory structure: when downloading by group ID: datasets/{groupId}/{datasetName}/...; when by name: datasets/{datasetName}/...

parameters.description: List of task group IDs, format: group1,group2,group3. Mutually exclusive with names parameter; group_ids takes precedence
parameters.name: group_ids

parameters.description: List of dataset names, format: dataset1,dataset2,dataset3. Mutually exclusive with group_ids parameter
parameters.name: names

200.description: ZIP file stream; the Content-Disposition header contains filename datasets.zip

400.description: Bad request parameters: 1) Parameter binding failed 2) Both parameters are empty 3) Both parameters provided

403.description: Permission error: requested dataset path is not within allowed scope

get.description: Get namespace lock status information
Get all records in ExecutionResult with status ExecutionSuccess, supports time range filtering and quantity filtering

200.description: Successfully returns the list of successful algorithm execution records

post.description: Get ground truth data for the given dataset array, used as benchmark data for algorithm evaluation. Supports batch query for ground truth information of multiple datasets

parameters.description: Ground truth query request, contains dataset list
parameters.name: body

200.description: Successfully returns ground truth information for datasets

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect JSON format or empty dataset array

post.description: Supports three query modes: 1) Directly pass an array of algorithm-dataset pairs for precise query; 2) Pass lists of algorithms and datasets for Cartesian product query; 3) Query by execution ID list. The three modes are mutually exclusive, only one can be selected

parameters.description: Raw data query request, supports three modes: pairs array, (algorithms+datasets) Cartesian product, or execution_ids list
parameters.name: body

200.description: Successfully returns the list of raw evaluation data

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect JSON format, query mode conflict or empty parameter

get.description: Fault injection record query interface supporting sorting and filtering. Returns the original database record list without data conversion.

parameters.description: Status filter, refer to field mapping interface (/mapping) for specific values
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Fault type filter, refer to field mapping interface (/mapping) for specific values
parameters.name: fault_type

parameters.description: Result quantity limit, used to control the number of returned records
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

200.description: Successfully returned fault injection record list

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect parameter format, validation failure, etc.

post.description: Submit fault injection task, supporting batch submission of multiple fault configurations, the system will automatically deduplicate and return submission results

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect JSON format, parameter validation failure, or invalid algorithm, etc.

get.description: Query all fault injection records without issues based on time range, returning detailed records including configuration information
get.summary: Query Fault Injection Records Without Issues

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

200.description: Successfully returned fault injection records without issues

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect time format or parameter validation failure, etc.

get.description: Get statistical information of fault injection records, including counts of records with issues, without issues, and total records

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect time format or parameter validation failure, etc.

get.description: Query all fault injection records with issues based on time range
get.summary: Query Fault Injection Records With Issues

parameters.description: Time range query, supports custom relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default not set
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required when lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

400.description: Request parameter error, such as incorrect time format or parameter validation failure, etc.

get.description: Get fault injection configuration for the specified namespace, supporting different display modes for configuration tree structure

parameters.description: Namespace, specifies the namespace to get configuration for
parameters.name: namespace

400.description: Request parameter error, such as missing namespace or mode parameter

get.description: Get fault injection configuration information based on multiple TraceIDs, used to view configuration details of submitted fault injection tasks

parameters.description: TraceID list, supports multiple values, used to query corresponding configuration information
parameters.name: trace_ids

400.description: Request parameter error, such as missing TraceID parameter or incorrect format

get.description: Get string-to-number mapping relationships for status and fault types, used for frontend display and API parameter validation

Get mapping of all namespaces and their corresponding resource information, or query resource information for a specific namespace. Returns a mapping table from namespace to resources, used for fault injection configuration and resource management

parameters.description: Namespace name, returns resource mappings for all namespaces if not specified
parameters.name: namespace

200.description: Returns resource information for the specified namespace when a namespace is provided

404.description: The specified namespace does not exist

500.description: Internal server error, unable to get resource mapping

get.description: Query fault injection record details by name or task ID, at least one of the two parameters must be provided

200.description: Successfully returned fault injection record details

400.description: Request parameter error, such as missing parameters, incorrect format, or validation failure, etc.

put.description: Cancel the specified fault injection task

get.description: Paginate and get task list by multiple conditions. Supports exact query by task ID, trace ID, group ID, or filter by type, status, etc.

parameters.description: Task ID - exact match (mutually exclusive with trace_id, group_id)
parameters.name: task_id

parameters.description: Trace ID - find all tasks in the same trace (mutually exclusive with task_id, group_id)
parameters.name: trace_id

parameters.description: Group ID - find all tasks in the same group (mutually exclusive with task_id, trace_id)
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: Immediate execution - true: immediate, false: delayed
parameters.name: immediate

parameters.description: Result limit, controls number of records returned
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Time range query, supports relative time (1h/24h/7d) or custom, default unset
parameters.name: lookback

parameters.description: Custom start time, RFC3339 format, required if lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_start_time

parameters.description: Custom end time, RFC3339 format, required if lookback=custom
parameters.name: custom_end_time

200.description: Successfully returned fault injection record list

400.description: Request parameter error, e.g. invalid format or validation failed

get.description: Paginate and get the list of tasks waiting in the queue
Get detailed information of a task by task ID, including basic info and execution logs
Get a simple list of all active algorithms without complex filtering

post.description: Submit multiple algorithm execution tasks in batch. Supports mixing datapack (v1 compatible) and dataset (v2 feature) executions.

404.description: Project, algorithm, datapack or dataset not found

post.description: Search algorithms with complex filtering, sorting and pagination. Algorithms are containers with type 'algorithm'
Upload detection results for detector algorithms via API instead of file collection
Upload granularity results for regular algorithms. Supports two modes: 1) Create new execution with algorithm_id and datapack_id, 2) Use existing execution_id via query parameter

parameters.description: Execution ID (optional, if not provided a new execution will be created)
parameters.name: execution_id

parameters.description: Label tag (optional, only used when creating new execution)
parameters.name: label

parameters.description: Granularity results with optional execution creation
parameters.name: request

post.description: Change password for authenticated user
Authenticate user with username and password
Logout user and invalidate token

get.description: Get profile information for authenticated user

post.description: Refresh an existing JWT token
Register a new user account

get.description: Get paginated list of containers with optional filtering

post.description: Create a new container without build configuration.
Build a container from provided source code (e.g., GitHub repository).
Search containers with complex filtering, sorting and pagination. Supports all container types (algorithm, benchmark, etc.)

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific container

delete.description: Delete a container (soft delete by setting status to false)

post.description: Create a new container version for an existing container.

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific container version

delete.description: Delete a container version (soft delete by setting status to false)

patch.description: Update an existing container version's information

get.description: Get a paginated list of datasets with filtering and sorting

post.description: Create a new dataset with optional injection and label associations
Advanced search for datasets with complex filtering

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific dataset

put.description: Update dataset information, injection and label associations

delete.description: Soft delete a dataset (sets status to -1)

get.description: Download dataset file by ID

patch.description: Add or remove injection associations for a dataset
Add, remove labels or create new labels for a dataset

post.description: Get execution results with predictions and ground truth for multiple algorithm-datapack pairs in a single request. Returns the latest execution for each pair if multiple executions exist.

parameters.description: Batch evaluation request containing multiple algorithm-datapack pairs
parameters.name: request

post.description: Get detector analysis results for multiple datapacks. If a datapack has multiple executions, returns the latest one.
Get execution results with predictions and ground truth for multiple algorithm-dataset pairs in a single request. Returns the latest execution for each datapack if multiple executions exist.

parameters.description: Batch evaluation request containing multiple algorithm-dataset pairs
parameters.name: request

get.description: Get the list of available label keys that can be used for filtering execution results
Get a paginated list of injections with filtering and sorting

parameters.description: Search in injection name and description
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Filter by tags (array of tag values)
parameters.name: tags

post.description: Create one or multiple injection records with automatic labeling based on task_id
Batch delete injections by IDs or labels with cascading deletion of related records
Advanced search for injections with complex filtering including custom labels

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific injection

delete.description: Soft delete an injection (sets status to -1)

patch.description: Add or remove custom labels (key-value pairs) for an injection
Add or remove tags for an injection

post.description: Create a new label with key-value pair. If a deleted label with same key-value exists, it will be restored and updated.

get.description: Get paginated list of permissions with optional filtering

Search roles with complex filtering and sorting

400.description: Invalid request format or search parameters

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific task including logs
Establishes a Server-Sent Events (SSE) connection to stream trace logs and task execution events in real-time. Returns historical events first, then switches to live monitoring.

Search users with complex filtering and sorting

delete.description: Remove a user from a project

Get system health status and service information

labels.description: Many-to-many relationships - use explicit intermediate tables for better control

benchmark.description: Benchmark database, add index and size limit

injection_name.description: Name injected in k8s resources with size limit

start_time.description: Expected fault start time, nullable with validation

task_id.description: Associated task ID, add composite index

category.description: Label category (dataset, fault_injection, algorithm, container, etc.)

project_id.description: Task can belong to a project (optional)

status.description: Status: Pending, Running, Completed, Error, Cancelled, Rescheduled

tag.description: Tag filter for filtering execution results

execution_id.description: Execution ID (0 if no execution found)

total_count.description: Total number of datapacks in dataset

execution_id.description: Execution ID (0 if no execution found)

tag.description: Tag filter for filtering execution results

found_count.description: Number of datapacks with detector results

not_found_count.description: Number of datapacks without detector results

injection_refs.description: Associated fault injection references (ID or name)

is_public.description: Whether public, optional, defaults to false

version.description: Dataset version, optional, defaults to v1.0

add_injections.description: List of fault injection IDs to add

remove_injections.description: List of fault injection IDs to remove

add_labels.description: List of label IDs to add

remove_labels.description: List of label IDs to remove

injection_refs.description: Update associated fault injection references (complete replacement)

label_ids.description: Update associated label ID list (complete replacement)

ids.description: List of injection IDs to delete

labels.description: List of label keys to match for deletion (key1:value1,key2:value2)

remove_labels.description: List of label keys to remove

add_tags.description: List of tag values to add

remove_tags.description: List of tag values to remove

include_labels.description: Whether to include labels in the response

include_task.description: Whether to include task details in the response

members.description: Related entities (only included when specifically requested)

benchmark.description: Benchmark database, add index and size limit

injection_name.description: Name injected in k8s resources with size limit

start_time.description: Expected fault start time, nullable with validation

task_id.description: Associated task ID, add composite index

value.description: Value (can be string, number, boolean, etc.)

role_ids.description: Role IDs that have this permission

project.description: Related entities (only included when specifically requested)
Related entities (only included when specifically requested)

restart_num.description: Number of restarts for the task

user_id.description: ID of the user who created the task (optional)

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
